articles.author: Hyunsu Yim, Ju-Min Park
articles.description: The main opposition Democratic Party has scheduled an impeachment vote for Saturday evening.
articles.title: Ruling party leader says South Korea president must be suspended as soon as possible

articles.author: Karam Al-Masri, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: A week after Islamist rebels seized Syria's second-largest city, in a surprise advance deep into government-held territory, Aleppo is slowly coming back to life.
articles.title: Syrian rebels restore services in Aleppo, seek to calm minorities

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thousands of people fled the central Syrian city of Homs overnight and into Friday morning, a war monitoring group and residents said, as rebel forces sought to push their lightning offensive against government forces further south.
articles.title: Thousands flee as Syrian rebels push on towards Homs

articles.author: Sakshi Dayal
articles.description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has accused the State Department and "deep state" elements in the U.S. of trying to destabilise India in conjunction with a group of investigative journalists and opposition leader Rahul Gandhi.
articles.title: Modi's BJP says US State Department targeting India

articles.author: Luiza Ilie
articles.description: Thousands of people rallied in the Romanian capital Bucharest late on Thursday in support of democracy ahead of a Sunday presidential election runoff that could see a far-right critic of the EU defeat a pro-European centrist candidate.
articles.title: Thousands attend pro-European rally in Romania ahead of presidential run-off vote

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The foreign ministers of Turkey, Iran, and Russia will meet in Doha on Saturday to discuss a lightning rebel advance in Syria, a Turkish diplomatic source said on Friday.
articles.title: Turkey, Iran and Russia to meet in Doha on Saturday to discuss Syria, Turkish source says

articles.author: Krisztina Than, Krisztina Fenyo
articles.description: Andre Iwan and his wife moved to a village in Hungary from eastern Germany a few months ago, complaining of high taxes and a feeling that immigration had turned them into "second-class citizens".
articles.title: Some German retirees find low-cost refuge in Orban's anti-migrant Hungary

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The European Union and South America's Mercosur bloc are expected on Friday to finalise a free trade agreement but it faces a tortuous battle for approval in Europe given firm French opposition.
articles.title: EU, Mercosur set to finalise contentious trade deal

articles.author: Asif Shahzad
articles.description: Pakistan's jailed former Prime Minister Imran Khan has called on his supporters to hold a rally next week and threatened to start a civil disobedience movement days after his party led a deadly protest march in Islamabad.
articles.title: Pakistan's jailed former PM Imran Khan threatens civil disobedience movement

articles.author: Yimou Lee, Ben Blanchard
articles.description: Taiwan's President Lai Ching-te urged China on Friday to "unclench its fists" and not take any unilateral actions, saying ahead of expected Chinese war games around the island that Beijing would not win any respect for military drills.
articles.title: Ahead of expected war games, Taiwan urges China to 'unclench its fists'
